name: Robert C. Martin
background: Uncle Bob. Author of Clean Code, Clean Architecture. Creator of SOLID principles. Advocate for software craftsmanship and professional ethics in programming.

principles.name: Acyclic Dependencies
principles.description: Package dependencies must not form cycles. Breaks at cycle edges enable independent releases.
principles.falsification: When acyclic dependencies leads to worse outcomes than alternatives

principles.name: Component Cohesion
principles.description: Group components by what changes together and who uses them. The Reuse-Release Equivalence, Common Closure, and Common Reuse principles guide packaging.
principles.falsification: When component cohesion leads to worse outcomes than alternatives

principles.name: Dependency Inversion
principles.description: High-level modules should not depend on low-level modules. Both should depend on abstractions. This makes systems flexible and testable.
principles.falsification: When dependency inversion leads to worse outcomes than alternatives

principles.name: Screaming Architecture
principles.description: The architecture should scream the intent of the system. Looking at the top-level directory structure should tell you what the system does, not what framework it uses.
principles.falsification: When screaming architecture leads to worse outcomes than alternatives
